channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Israeli air strike destroys part of last functioning hospital in Gaza City
item.description: The Israel Defense Forces said the hospital contained a "command and control center used by Hamas".

item.title: US and Iran hold 'constructive' first round of nuclear talks
item.description: The highest-level talks between the two nations since Trump's first term in office will resume next week.

item.title: Israel says it will expand its offensive across most of Gaza
item.description: Israel's defence minister also said it had taken over a "security zone", which separates the southern cities of Rafah and Khan Younis.

item.title: As an Israeli hostage turns 48, his wife waits for blue ticks on her messages
item.description: Eighteen months since Omri Miran was taken hostage by Hamas, his wife Lishay still sends family updates, which she hopes he will read one day.

item.title: Red Cross chief says Gaza is 'hell on earth' as Israeli assault continues
item.description: "No state... can be exempt from the obligation not to commit war crimes, not to commit genocide, not to commit ethnic cleansing," Mirjana Spoljaric tells the BBC.

item.title: 'We collected his body instead of celebrating Eid,' says mother of Gaza medic killed by Israel
item.description: The mother of a Palestinian killed in an IDF attack on emergency vehicles tells the BBC of her loss.

item.title: Schools in Beirut suburb fear return to war after new Israeli strikes
item.description: Students, staff, and parents alike are traumatised by what has happened and the destruction that surrounds them.

item.title: Palestinian teen attacker freed after nine years in Israeli prison
item.description: Amnesty International says Ahmed Manasra endured "shocking ill-treatment" after he was imprisoned at the age of 13 in 2015.

item.title: Israeli army fired more than 100 shots in Gaza medics' killing, audio suggests
item.description: The analysis shows Israeli troops fired 100 shots during the attack which killed 15 people.

item.title: 'Part of us is still in Gaza': Freed Israeli hostages fight for a new ceasefire
item.description: Hostages released earlier this year are adding their powerful voices to calls for a deal to bring home those still held by Hamas.

item.title: Israel's PM rejects criticism of Gaza war by air force reservists
item.description: The military says it will dismiss reservists who called for the hostages' return to be prioritised over fighting Hamas.

item.title: Sudan accuses UAE of 'complicity in genocide' at world court
item.description: Sudan's government alleges that the UAE is arming its civil war opponents, which it denies.

item.title: Israeli strike on Gaza residential building kills 29, medics say
item.description: The Israeli military says it had struck a "senior Hamas terrorist" in the Shejaiya neighbourhood of Gaza City.

item.title: What is Iran's nuclear programme and what does the US want?
item.description: Donald Trump has suggested Iran could face military action if it does not agree to a new nuclear deal.

item.title: Chemical burns, assaults, electric shocks - Gazans tell BBC of torture in Israeli detention
item.description: Interviews with five men held in the months after the Hamas attacks reveal allegations of violence and abuse, adding to reports of misconduct by military and prison staff.

item.title: Israeli strikes in Syria a challenge to Turkey
item.description: Israeli air strikes on bases in Syria are a warning to Turkey to keep its military assets away.

item.title: Hezbollah at crossroads after blows from war weaken group
item.description: The BBC's Hugo Bachega explores the future for Hezbollah in the wake of Israel's devastating attacks.

item.title: Gaza bakeries shut and painkillers on ration after month of Israeli blockade
item.description: Many Palestinians say they are going hungry after Israel stopped all aid deliveries to put pressure on Hamas.

item.title: Survivor challenges Israeli account of attack on Gaza paramedics
item.description: Palestinian paramedic Munther Abed rejects Israel's assertion that the vehicles approached troops with their lights off.

item.title: Wounded Palestinians dying over lack of supplies, US surgeon who worked in Gaza says
item.description: Dr Mark Perlmutter says doctors are working without soap, antibiotics or x-ray facilities, as Israel has resumed its offensive against Hamas.

item.title: 'I was afraid for my life': At the scene of the attack on Palestinian Oscar winner
item.description: The Palestinian Oscar winner's West Bank home was attacked by Israeli settlers. Ballal's co-director says his acclaim "does not help us on the ground".

item.title: The Indian scholar arrested in US over father-in-law's Hamas link
item.description: Friends and family of Badar Khan Suri in India say they are shocked by the terror charges against him.

item.title: 'We will rescue anyone': BBC accompanies Syria's White Helmets after deadly attacks
item.description: The BBC accompanies the civil defence group as they respond to violence in Syria's coastal region.

item.title: Is the war starting again in Gaza?
item.description: Is the truce finished after Israeli air strikes across Gaza?

item.title: British daughter of Gaza hostage says burying father 'incredibly meaningful'
item.description: Sharone Lifschitz said it was important all families were reunited with their relatives, both dead and alive

item.title: Who is Mahmoud Khalil, Palestinian student activist facing US deportation?
item.description: The Columbia University graduate had a key role in student protests over Gaza. Trump said his arrest was the first of "many to come".

item.title: Palestinian comedian is 'proud and hurt' after making Netflix hit
item.description: Actor and comedian Mo Amer explains why he avoided mentioning the 7 October attack in the show's storyline.

item.title: Syrian bloodshed heaps pressure on Sharaa and exposes deep fractures
item.description: Deadly violence in Syria's Alawite heartland is the worst since rebels toppled Bashar al-Assad in December.

item.title: Party drug MDMA may have protected survivors of Nova attack from trauma, study suggests
item.description: Neuroscientists in Israel find signs that the drug helped festival survivors in the attack and the aftermath.

item.title: Gazans face tough choices as their future is debated on the global stage
item.description: Their fate is the discussion of Arab leaders in Egypt but what do Gazans want for their future?

item.title: Watch: What we learned from Trump's meeting with Netanyahu
item.description: Netanyahu is the first world leader to visit the White House since the US president announced tariffs on global trading partners.

item.title: BBC Verify analyses video showing Israel's killing of Gaza medics
item.description: The IDF's killing of 15 emergency workers has drawn international condemnation. BBC Verify examines new footage of the incident.

item.title: Video casts doubt on Israeli account of Gaza medic killings
item.description: The video was published by the Palestine Red Crescent Society (PRCS), which said it was obtained from the phone of a paramedic who was killed.

item.title: Videos show aftermath of Israeli strike on Gaza school-turned-shelter
item.description: BBC Verify explains what we know about the incident after reviewing videos that were posted online.

item.title: BBC Verify: Assessing Israel's renewed ground operation
item.description: Israel has sent more troops into Gaza after resuming airstrikes on what it calls "terror targets".

item.title: Watch: Explosions over Gaza as Israel launches new strikes against Hamas
item.description: The Israeli military says it is hitting "terror targets" across Gaza.

item.title: 'They live in big fear': The BBC visits displaced Alawites in Lebanon
item.description: Thousands of Syrians have crossed into Lebanon from the provinces of Latakia and Tartus.
